metadata.Title: CVE-2016-8636 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Integer overflow in the mem_check_range function in drivers/infiniband/sw/rxe/rxe_mr.c in the Linux kernel before 4.9.10 allows local users to cause a denial of service (memory corruption), obtain sensitive information from kernel memory, or possibly have unspecified other impact via a write or read request involving the "RDMA protocol over infiniband" (aka Soft RoCE) technology. It was discovered that an integer overflow existed in the InfiniBand RDMA over ethernet (RXE) transport implementation in the Linux kernel. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-8636` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.11.0-1009-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
linux-image-extra-4.11.0-1009-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-4.10.0-1004-gcp - 4.10.0-1004.4
linux-image-extra-4.10.0-1004-gcp - 4.10.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-4.10.0-27-generic - 4.10.0-27.30~16.04.2
linux-image-4.10.0-27-generic-lpae - 4.10.0-27.30~16.04.2
linux-image-4.10.0-27-lowlatency - 4.10.0-27.30~16.04.2
linux-image-extra-4.10.0-27-generic - 4.10.0-27.30~16.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-4.11.0-1009-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
linux-image-extra-4.11.0-1009-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-4.10.0-1004-gcp - 4.10.0-1004.4
linux-image-extra-4.10.0-1004-gcp - 4.10.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-4.10.0-27-generic - 4.10.0-27.30~16.04.2
linux-image-4.10.0-27-generic-lpae - 4.10.0-27.30~16.04.2
linux-image-4.10.0-27-lowlatency - 4.10.0-27.30~16.04.2
linux-image-extra-4.10.0-27-generic - 4.10.0-27.30~16.04.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> android kernels (flo, goldfish, grouper, maguro, mako and manta) are not supported on the Ubuntu Touch 14.10 and earlier preview kernels linux-lts-saucy no longer receives official support linux-lts-quantal no longer receives official support

criterions.comment: linux-azure package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.11.0-1009.9').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-gcp package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.10.0-1004.4').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.10.0-27.30~16.04.2').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-signed-azure package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.11.0-1009.9').
linux-signed-gcp package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.10.0-1004.4').
linux-signed-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.10.0-27.30~16.04.2').
